text.p: Ajax Amsterdam winger Marc Overmars has been recalled by the Netherlands for Saturday's World Cup group seven qualifier against Wales in Eindhoven.
Overmars last played for the Dutch in December 1995 in the 2-0 win over Ireland that booked a place at Euro 96. But he had a knee operation shortly after that match and missed the finals.

Coach Guus Hiddink was forced to make three changes from the squad that won 3-1 in Wales last month, with Ajax's versatile Winston Bogarde, PSV Eindhoven's Stan Valckx and Manchester United's Jordi Cruyff all unfit.
Hiddink has found replacements in England, Germany and Italy, bringing back Arsenal's Dennis Bergkamp, Johan de Kock from Germany's Schalke 04 and AC Milan's Michael Reiziger.

Celtic's troubled striker Pierre van Hooijdonk, who came on as a substitute in Cardiff to score two late goals, and Vitesse Arnhem's Roy Makaay are retained. But there is no room for Patrick Kluivert, Peter Hoekstra, Richard Witschge and John Veldman, who are only just returning to Ajax after injury.
Goalkeepers - Edwin van der Sar (Ajax), Ed de Goey (Feyenoord).
Defenders - Frank de Boer (Ajax), Arthur Numan, Jaap Stam (both PSV), Ferdy Vierklau (Vitesse), Andre Ooyer (Roda JC), Michael Reiziger (AC Milan), Johan De Kock (Schalke).
Midfielders - Ronald de Boer (Ajax), Aron Winter (Inter Milan), Clarence Seedorf (Real Madrid), Philip Cocu, Wim Jonk (both PSV), Giovanni van Bronkhorst (Feyenoord).
Forwards - Youri Mulder (Schalke), Dennis Bergkamp (Arsenal), Pierre van Hooijdonk (Celtic), Marc Overmars (Ajax), Roy Makaay (Vitesse).
